italic.text: A member of the Armed Forces assigned to accompany, assist, or guide an individual or group.

line.text: An armed guard that accompanies a convoy, a train, prisoners, etc.
In SWORD, to accompany refugee units toward a specific location (a position or a camp, for instance).
Lines used by units to adapt their behavior when they reach or cross them.
Right or left boundaries inside which the agent performs the mission.

Location into which the agent has to accompany the refugee units.
Refugee units to be transported to the given location.
The agent moves toward each given refugee unit, from the nearest to the furthest.
Average speed depends on the physical capabilities regarding the terrain properties.
Upon reaching a refugee unit, the agent loads it (magic tranportation).
Once all units have been loaded, they are tranported to the given position.
Upon reaching the destination, all transported units are unloaded onto the given position.
If a refugee unit is not reachable (the unit is located inside a urban block inside which the agent cannot move, for instance), the agent moves as close as possible.
If a refugee unit is moving the agent will follow it until it is reached.
The mission ends once all the refugee units have been transported to the given location.
